cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 525 mi SSE of Bermuda and 1170 mi ESE of Cape Fear, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Accelerating west-northwest across the southwest Atlantic, then turning northwest toward the North Carolina/South Carolina coast late Wednesday–Thursday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Cape Fear, North Carolina (NC/SC border area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane and storm-surge watches expected Tuesday for the Carolina and Mid-Atlantic coasts; none for Florida
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Primarily North Carolina, South Carolina and portions of the Mid-Atlantic shoreline; Florida east coast mainly experiences high surf and rip currents
weather_observation.wind: Outer bands may bring occasional gusts under tropical-storm strength (below 39 mph); gale-force winds are improbable (<10%).
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant storm surge expected along the St. Johns River or the northeast Florida coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Passing outer rain bands could drop 1–2 inches, locally higher, mainly late Thursday through Friday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along NE Florida beaches beginning mid-week.
